info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 3 at 10:50PM CDT until June 7 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Springfield MO
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri...
Little Osage River near Horton affecting Vernon County.
Marmaton River near Nevada affecting Vernon County.
For the Little Osage River...including Horton...Minor flooding is forecast. For the Marmaton River...including Nevada...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Little Osage River near Horton.
* WHEN...From late Wednesday night to Saturday evening.
* IMPACTS...At 41.0 feet, minor flooding affects low lying areas near the gage site and farmland along the river.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 PM CDT Tuesday the stage was 33.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 41.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Thursday morning to a crest of 42.7 feet Thursday evening. It will then fall below flood stage Friday evening. - Flood stage is 41.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 42.7 feet on 11/02/2013. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Many flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
Wednesday evening at 1100 PM CDT.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT TO SATURDAY EVENING
